resources.string: In order to correctly pronounce, and later write Bengali words, it\'s important to learn the sounds of the language. Refer to the pronunciation guide along with the flashcards, use google translate, or ideally ask someone how to pronounce something.

With aspirated consonants you let your breath out producing a “h” sound. With normal consonants (aka how most English words are pronounced) you want to restrain your breath. Ghana is aspirated. Guard is not. Tap and hold on the examples below.

To effectively learn Bengali words, speak English but substitute the English nouns and verbs with Bengali ones (especially around fluent speakers). English words are often mixed into Bengali anyway. Immersion will speed up learning.
Pronouns of objects depend on point of reference (here or there) and if its plural. Some of these prepositions (“the”) become suffixes of the word. The following examples use book ([bɔi]).

In general just add an -er to the end of a word as if it were an apostrophe-s. Ownership pronouns also follow a similar pattern, ending in r. This is equivalent to saying “their”, “my”, or “your”. “His” and “her” are the same because there is no gender differentiation.
In Bengali there is no need for an “is”, “am”, or “are” verbs. Simply omit such “to be” words and you can already form full sentences with adjectives.
Verbs Present Progressive Tense and Simple Sentences

"Verbs in Bengali must be conjugated. There are only three for each tense though, and it stays the same for every verb. Continue to substitute nouns in English, and just get comfortable with the rhythm of speech. For present tense let's use walk as an example: "
"It is very common practice to omit the subject though, because it is implied by how the verb is said. So simply - “Hospitale hatchi”, “Hospitale hatcho”, and “Hospitale hatcche” "
"Prepositions and conjunctions in Bengali work exactly the same as in English.Here is a good time to start doing vocabulary. "
